quiz.question: Which nutrient group includes sugars, starches, and fiber?
Which macronutrient's excess intake most directly increases urinary nitrogen excretion?
Which historic observation led to standardized calorie tables and food energy science?
Which label ingredient indicates added simple sugars rather than natural sugars?
Which effect reduces calorie absorption from some high-fiber meals?
Which fatty acid class contains essential omega-3s and omega-6s required in the diet?
Which common kitchen measurement often differs from a serving size?
What does nutrient density measure in a food?
What major limitation separates bomb calorimeter readings from physiological energy?
Which food component supplies energy but is not an essential nutrient?
Which advanced concept links caloric content with hormonal responses influencing appetite?
Which essential fatty acid family includes linoleic acid with known calorie contribution?
Which phenomenon explains why some high-fat foods feel less filling per calorie than protein-rich foods?
Which advanced sweetener can be fermented by gut microbes producing calories unexpectedly?
Which factor causes alcohol to be metabolized preferentially over other macronutrients?
